description.p: XmlBlasterClassLoader is a derivation of URLClassLoader.
This ClassLoader is used by the PluginManagerBase and can be set to a dedicated classpath which is derived from the plugin which the user whishes to be loaded.
An instance of the XmlblasterClassLoader will be created by the ClassLoaderFactory on demand.
The package name of the plugin gives the path under $XMLBLASTER_HOME/lib where the classloader has to look for possible classes.
The system classpath or the environment has no effect on this classloader!
Classes beginning with java. and org.xmlBlaster. will be loaded by the parent classloader to avoid bringing in some corrupt own classes in the system.

example.p: Assume we have a plugin called XMLDBPlugin and it resides in the package org.xmlBlaster.engine.persistence.xmldb.
And assume furthermore this plugin needs some third party library.
So let's take these jars and put them in the directory under $XMLBLASTER_HOME/lib/org/xmlBlaster/engine/persistence/xmldb/XMLDBPlugin.
Since the ClassLoder knows the FQCN it can determine the path where to look for optional additional libraries.
